channel.title: Need some help.... With environment variables
channel.description:
Alright, whenever I use my Run.Bat, I keep getting the message [code] 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command. [/code]
Anybody know how to fix this? I know its something with my environment variables... can someone tell me what to put for them? My JDK is JDK 6update7 please help.

item.title: Need some help.... With environment variables
item.dc:creator: @spiky27 spiky27
item.description:
@spiky27 wrote:

mmm 6.7 didnt work for me so i just kept my j6u6 code and it still works…try those (they are in almost all the new “how to make a server” tuts)

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help.... With environment variables

item.title: Need some help.... With environment variables
item.dc:creator: @II_Josh_II II Josh II
item.description:
@II_Josh_II wrote:

Have you set your Variable Path in “My Computer” To the correct one?

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help.... With environment variables

item.title: Need some help.... With environment variables
item.dc:creator: @_Ben `Ben
item.description:
@_Ben wrote:

can you do any other commads like ipconfig or tskill?

if not then under your enviromental variable “path” put a semicolon after what ever you have there and put %SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem

Read full topic
item.source: Need some help.... With environment variables

item.title: Need some help.... With environment variables
item.dc:creator: @xoskullxo13 xoskullxo13
item.description:
@xoskullxo13 wrote:

Right-click on “Run.Bat or Runserver.bat” and where it says something like this: “.;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server” edit the 3.0.08 to your java version… I think…

Read full topic
